topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Cold open on making intuition explicit, then Lenny introduces Annie Duke’s background (poker, author, First Round Capital) and previews key topics: decision-making, feedback loops, and quitting.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Vanta and UserTesting.

topics.title: Lessons from Daniel Kahneman
topics.summary: Annie reflects on Kahneman’s humility, openness to being wrong (e.g., priming replication issues), and his practice of adversarial collaboration to resolve disagreements through joint research.

topics.title: Parenting advice and resilience mindset
topics.summary: Annie shares practical parenting principles: kids need to feel deeply loved, mistakes happen (babies will bonk their heads), and parents have limited influence on temperament—focus on basics like manners.

topics.title: Decision tools for parenting and leadership
topics.summary: She applies decision concepts to parenting: Kahneman’s “nothing is as important as it seems,” mental time travel to reduce present-bias, and using “nevertheless” to acknowledge feelings while holding boundaries—also useful at work.

topics.title: How much better can decisions get?
topics.summary: Annie argues improvement can be large if people actually implement tools; she cites Kahneman’s structured hiring work improving hit rates (roughly 50% to 65%), but notes adoption is the hard part.

topics.title: Fix meetings: separate discover, discuss, decide
topics.summary: Core tactic: stop discovering opinions in live meetings; collect inputs independently/asynchronously (nominal group), use meetings only for discussion (especially disagreements), and decide outside the room to reduce social influence and hierarchy effects.

topics.title: DRI concerns: making people feel heard
topics.summary: Annie explains how to avoid coercive “alignment” culture: facilitate curiosity, reflect back people’s views, enforce turn-taking, and use questions for clarification—people accept decisions better when they feel accurately understood.

topics.title: Operationalizing independent input and private voting
topics.summary: They recap the workflow (independent brainstorm/estimates → discuss deltas → decide), noting decisions can be made by a single owner or via private voting; Annie adds you can also pause live meetings to capture independent estimates on the fly.

topics.title: First Round context and long-term decision quality
topics.summary: Prompted by Brett Berson’s question, Annie sets up the challenge of evaluating decision quality when outcomes take years (e.g., venture investing) and why typical “we’ll know in a decade” thinking is flawed.

topics.title: No long feedback loops: create proxy signals
topics.summary: Annie argues there’s no such thing as a long feedback loop if you choose leading indicators: identify necessary-but-not-sufficient milestones (e.g., Series A, PMF, traction, retention) that correlate with eventual success to shorten learning cycles.
